content:
"""
Ah, we need to collect iron ore first before we can add it to the furnaces.
Let's reorganize our approach:
"""

# First collect our copper plates
copper_furnace = get_entities([Prototype.StoneFurnace])[-1]  # Last placed furnace
if inspect_inventory(copper_furnace).get(Prototype.CopperPlate, 0) > 0:
    extract_item(Prototype.CopperPlate, copper_furnace.position, quantity=10)

# Get iron ore
move_to(nearest(Resource.IronOre))
harvest_resource(nearest(Resource.IronOre), quantity=30)

# Now add iron ore to furnaces
iron_furnaces = get_entities([Prototype.StoneFurnace])[:2]  # First two furnaces
for furnace in iron_furnaces:
    move_to(furnace.position)
    if inspect_inventory(furnace).get(Prototype.IronOre, 0) < 5:
        insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace, quantity=10)

# Get more copper ore
move_to(nearest(Resource.CopperOre))
harvest_resource(nearest(Resource.CopperOre), quantity=20)

# Add copper ore to copper furnace
move_to(copper_furnace.position)
insert_item(Prototype.CopperOre, copper_furnace, quantity=10)

# Fix the mining drill with no resources
problematic_drill = None
for drill in get_entities([Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill]):
    if drill.status == "EntityStatus.NO_MINABLE_RESOURCES":
        problematic_drill = drill
        break

if problematic_drill:
    pickup_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, problematic_drill.position)
    new_iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
    move_to(new_iron_pos)
    new_drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=new_iron_pos)
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, new_drill, quantity=10)

print("\nProduction lines restocked:")
print("Inventory:", inspect_inventory())
print("\nEntities and their status:")
for entity in get_entities():
    print(f"{entity.name} at {entity.position}: {entity.status}")
    print(f"Contents: {inspect_inventory(entity)}")
    if hasattr(entity, 'warnings') and entity.warnings:
        print(f"Warnings: {entity.warnings}")
